article_title: Air crash payouts: How they work
article_text: He said that Lufthansa was entitled to set an initial ceiling for  claims at around £100,000 per victim—so long as it  could demonstrate that it was not negligent as the carrier.   Exact amounts will vary according to whether the victim was a  family breadwinner and how much they earned—thus a  high-earning passenger with several dependents is far more likely  to receive the full £100,000 payout than a child, Burns  added.
